channel.title: Home on Reuben Cleetus
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Reuben Cleetus

item.title: Git as the Shared Brain: My Hybrid Agentic Dev Workflow
item.description: Running two AI coding agents across phone and terminal without losing context, and why Git is a better coordination layer than conversation history.

item.title: VSCode Was Built for the Agentic Age Before It Existed
item.description: The architectural decisions Microsoft made in VSCode between 2016 and 2022 accidentally created the perfect foundation for AI agents. Here’s why those decisions mattered more than anyone predicted.

item.title: OpenClaw and the Shift from Chat to Delegation
item.description: I installed OpenClaw expecting a weekend experiment. What I found was something closer to delegated execution, and a clear lesson in why trust boundaries matter when your AI agent has shell access.

item.title: From AI Pilot to Operating Model
item.description: 88% of AI pilots never reach production. The ones that do share a pattern: they rebuild workflows from scratch instead of automating the old ones, and they treat the cultural shift as the actual work.

item.title: The Wrong First Question in Azure AI
item.description: The Responses API going GA in Azure AI Foundry isn’t primarily a model story. It’s a runtime architecture decision that most teams make too late.

item.title: About
item.description:
Background

I’m a technologist focused on artificial intelligence, software systems, and building practical tools that actually get used. My work sits at the intersection of modern AI, product engineering, and real-world problem solving.

I’ve spent my time learning by building: experimenting with models, shipping software, studying how systems scale, and figuring out what makes technology valuable outside of demos and hype.

This site is where I think in public about what I’m learning, what I’m building, and where I think AI and software are heading.

item.title: Contact
item.description:
